dt.t: {it}told{/it} the whole story to us
could never {wi}tell{/wi} a lie
don't {wi}tell{/wi} your password
she never {it}told{/it} her love
{wi}tell{/wi} us about your job
they did not do it, I {wi}tell{/wi} you
{it}told{/it} me to wait
you can {wi}tell{/wi} it's a masterpiece
{wi}tell{/wi} the stars, if thou be able to number them
an article {it}telling{/it} of her experience

dt: {bc}to tell someone (such as a parent or other person of authority) about what someone else has done

dt.t: I'll get even with you if you ever {wi}tell{/wi} on me
the pressure was beginning to {wi}tell{/wi} on him

pt: {sc}reveal{/sc} {sc}disclose{/sc} {sc}divulge{/sc} {sc}tell{/sc} {sc}betray{/sc} mean to make known what has been or should be concealed. {sc}reveal{/sc} may apply to supernatural or inspired revelation of truths beyond the range of ordinary human vision or reason.

pt.t: divine will as {it}revealed{/it} in sacred writings

pt: {sc}disclose{/sc} may imply a discovering but more often an imparting of information previously kept secret.
{sc}divulge{/sc} implies a disclosure involving some impropriety or breach of confidence.
{sc}tell{/sc} implies an imparting of necessary or useful information.
{sc}betray{/sc} implies a divulging that represents a breach of faith or an involuntary or unconscious disclosure.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}tellan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}zellen{/it} to count, tell, Old English {it}talu{/it} tale

dt: {bc}an inadvertent behavior or mannerism that betrays a poker player's true thoughts, intentions, or emotions

dt.t: The World Series of Poker: earth's greatest liars gathered together with millions of dollars on the line … . It's a blur of action, but the educated spectator ignores these distractions and focuses on the players' mannerisms—it's all part of the science of {wi}tells{/wi}, reflexes a player can't control that, read right, give away his thoughts.

dt: {bc}a revealing gesture, expression, etc., that is likened to a poker player's tell

dt.t: But his eyes darted fractionally to one side as he said it …; the classic liar's {wi}tell{/wi}.
I talked to staffers who said that their bosses had two or three flights booked getting out of town, a big {wi}tell{/wi} that there was not going to be a deal.

shortdef: an inadvertent behavior or mannerism that betrays a poker player's true thoughts, intentions, or emotions
a revealing gesture, expression, etc., that is likened to a poker player's tell; broadly : sign, indication

dt: {bc}an ancient mound in the Middle East composed of remains of successive settlements

shortdef: hill, mound; specifically : an ancient mound in the Middle East composed of remains of successive settlements

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}a written account (such as a biography) that contains revealing and often scandalous information

shortdef: a written account (such as a biography) that contains revealing and often scandalous information

dt.t: {it}told{/it} him {it}off{/it} for his arrogance
{it}told off{/it} a detail and put them to opening a trench

shortdef: to number and set apart; especially : to assign to a special duty

dt: locality in central Egypt on the east bank of the Nile River northwest of Asyût
Tell el Amarna is the site of the ruins of an ancient Egyptian city that was both built and abandoned in the 14th century {sc}b.c.{/sc}

shortdef: locality in central Egypt on the east bank of the Nile River northwest of Asyût

dt: {bc}to show that something different is true from what someone says is true

dt.t: He said he wasn't at the scene of the crime, but the fingerprints {it}tell a different story{/it}.

shortdef: to show that something different is true from what someone says is true

dt.t: His unkempt appearance is bound to {it}tell against{/it} him in court.

dt: {bc}to see what the differences are between (people or things) {bc}to identify (people or things that look similar to each other)

dt.t: It's hard to {it}tell{/it} the twins {it}apart{/it}.

shortdef: to see what the differences are between (people or things) : to identify (people or things that look similar to each other)
